ul.li: The "background" property always sets all the individual background properties ((initial is "not defined for shorthand properties"), applies to all elements, not inherited, and percentage values are allowed on "background- position")

body.p: If statement above is passed, this paragraph should be UA-default (initial) values. All of the individual background properties should be set to their initial (UA-default) values. The rule applied is "p {background: }". So the background property applies to the "p" element. aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb cccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccc This emphasized text should be UA-default, since the background property is not inherited, and "em" is a child of 'h3". No explicit rule is applied for "em". However, the parent's background properties may shine through by default. body.h4: THis h4 element should have an oval button image which is centered. THe rule applied is "background: url(ovalbbut.gif) aqua no-repeat 50%50%". All other specific properties should be initialized. body.p: All other properties of this page should be UA-default. This is a paragraph like the one above.
